ul.li1: 1The oracle concerning Nineveh—
ul.li2: the scroll of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite:

chapter.pericope: Half-Acrostic: Yahweh Takes Vengeance against His Enemies

ul.li1: 2Yahweh is a jealous God and avenging;
ul.li2: Yahweh is avenging and full of wrath.Literally “a lord of wrath”
ul.li1: Yahweh takes vengeance against his enemies;
ul.li2: he rages against his adversaries.
ul.li1: 3Yahweh is slow to anger but great in power;
ul.li2: he will certainly not allow the guilty to go unpunished.
ul.li1: He marchesLiterally “His path” in storm wind and in gale;
ul.li2: storm clouds are the dust of his feet.
ul.li1: 4He rebukes the sea and he dries up the rivers;
ul.li2: he makes all the rivers run dry.
ul.li1: Bashan and Carmel wither;MT reads “languishes,” but the versions reflect “withers,” which also restores the acrostic
ul.li2: the blossom of Lebanon languishes.
ul.li1: 5Mountains quake before him;
ul.li2: the hills shake apart.Or “melt”
ul.li1: The earth heaves before him—
ul.li2: the world and all her inhabitants.
ul.li1: 6His indignation—who can stand before it?
ul.li2: Who can endure his fierce anger?Literally “the heat of his anger”
ul.li1: His wrath is poured out like fire;
ul.li2: rocks are shattered beforeOr “by” him.
ul.li1: 7Yahweh is good—a refuge in the day of distress;
ul.li2: he knows those who take refuge in him.
ul.li1: 8But with a rushing torrent he will bring Nineveh to an end;
ul.li2: he will chase his enemies into darkness.

ul.li1: 9WhatOr “Why …?” do you plot against Yahweh?
ul.li2: He will completely destroy it;Literally “he will make a complete destruction”
ul.li3: trouble will not rise up a second time!
ul.li1: 10For like entangled thorns,
ul.li2: and like their drink which is drunk,
ul.li3: they will be consumed like fully dry chaff.
ul.li1: 11From you goes out one who plots evil against Yahweh,
ul.li2: one who plans wickedness.

chapter.pericope: Yahweh Will Deliver Judah and Destroy Nineveh

ul.li1: “Even though they are powerful and likewise many,
ul.li2: even so they will be cut off and pass away.
ul.li1: Though I have afflicted you,That is, Judah
ul.li2: I will afflict youThat is, Judah no longer.
ul.li1: 13And now, I will break his yoke from upon you;
ul.li2: I will snap your bonds.”

ul.li1: “Your name will no longer be sown.
ul.li2: I will cut off the idols and imagesLiterally “the idols and the molten idols” from the templeLiterally “house” of your gods;
ul.li3: I will send you to the graveLiterally “I will make your grave” because you are worthless.”
ul.li1: 15Nahum 1:15–2:13 in the English Bible is 2:1–14 in the Hebrew Bible Look! On the mountains!
ul.li2: The feet of the one who brings good tidings,
ul.li1: “Celebrate a festival, O Judah,
ul.li2: Fulfill your vows!
ul.li1: For he will not invade you again;
ul.li2: the wicked one is cut off completely!”
